Discover the mission, values, and people behind Yogamos.
Everything you need to know about Yogamos and our offerings.
What styles of yoga does Yogamos offer?
We offer a variety of styles including Hatha, Vinyasa, Yin, and guided meditation sessions.
Absolutely! We provide beginner-friendly classes and resources to help you start your journey.
How can I access live classes?
Live-streamed sessions are available in the Inner Balance and Mastery Path plans.
Yes! We organize retreats, workshops, and community gatherings throughout the year.
While our platform is digital-first, we also offer in-person retreats and pop-up classes in select locations.
How do I become a certified yoga instructor through Yogamos?
The Mastery Path plan includes teacher training modules and certification opportunities.
A yoga mat is recommended, but many classes can be done with minimal or no equipment.
Can I cancel my subscription anytime?
Yes, you can cancel or change plans anytime through your account settings.
Our team of experienced yogis and wellness experts bring their knowledge and passion to help guide you on your journey.
Sebastian has over 15 years of experience in yoga and mindfulness, specializing in Hatha and Pranayama practices.
A dedicated teacher with a background in Vinyasa and Yin Yoga, Sofia integrates movement and breathwork for holistic healing.
Yash leads guided meditation and mindfulness workshops to help practitioners find inner peace and clarity.
Yogamos is more than just yoga—it’s a journey toward balance, mindfulness, and self-discovery.
At Yogamos, we aim to create a welcoming space where everyone, regardless of experience, can connect with their inner self through yoga, meditation, and mindfulness practices.
Yogamos was founded with the vision of making yoga accessible to all. Inspired by ancient traditions and modern wellness approaches, we have created a space that nurtures both body and mind.
